comment.body: @Rebelb0y11:  Which part of your hight expectations was not met?
You can also tick the box "Follow comments on your posts" at the top, just right of your name.
Your parents must be funny people
Hi from Switzerland. I just spent a day with porte√±os that I have known for almost a decade :-)
@Pablo Arroyo: Cool, turns out that I spent a night in Catamarca a long time ago.  [viaje con casa rodante. media 2007 en america do sur](/1MrcCZjfRCKeJZAENsjDqf7dvDhEhFpsXY/#apr20)
Switzerland is nice. But so are a lot of places.
I use git

Zeronet is specialized for websites, while IPFS is for files of any type and any size. So, ZeroNet has additional logic like for blogging or ZeroMe. IPFS has additional logic for splitting up large files into junks, and streaming them to requesting users.
@Pablo Arroyo: The zite is bigger than usual. You have to click yes when it asks you to increase the limit.
Sure, what else?
How will the block reward be determined afterwards? Will there be premined zcash in existence in the first month?
I don't think there is an automatic procedure. Just copy the posts from wordpress to your zero blog, and convert the formatting of links and pictures.
Probably best to run zeronet on your personal server, and connect with your mobile browser through an encrypted channel.
@RiotPulv: Impressive list. But I didn't find any of the top listed ones in the debian repository. Any experience with one of them?
You only talk about the present. What about the future? What if somebody copies your harddrive on a border crossing?
I can help with c++, but didn't quite understand the problem.
What popup? I wasn't aware that movies can contain popups.
Do you know anything that's less creepy? Facebook? Google+ maybe?
It's not perfect. If you find anything better, please let us know.
@Version: I wonder how they track youtube-dl. I mean the IP address still matches, but if it is added to the same profile as when you use a browser.

When I switched to Linux ten years ago, I was also worried that there might be some programs that I would like to keep using. Thus I used Wine and Windows in a VM for a short period of time. But I gave up on that sooner than I expected. If something is not available in opensource for linux, I have no use for it.
Do you have any idea what went wrong? A trojan that grabed your private key?
Tomorrow there will be climate demos all over Switzerland https://www.klimademo.ch/
OneNet

Tox is still going? 
After my system no longer updated from https://pkg.tox.chat/debian/  I thought the project was dead.

With a full blockchain like ethereum, every user has all the data. Every blockchain has a monetary part to secure its consistency.
With ZeroNet, each user decides which zites he wants do download and seed. Some zites even have optional files like e.g. videos. 
So, no the two are totally different on a technical level, and have totally different use cases.
I remember some years ago people asking which is better Wifi or Bluetooth, and if one can replace the other. Ethereum and Zeronet are even more different than Wifi and Bluetooth  ;-)

@blurHY: I didn't look into IPZN yet, but I think it can work well by just replacing the transport layer to something that is used a lot also in other projects. Whereas blockchains are an entirely different beast. FileCoin is just to incentivize IPFS node operators to store specific content. I don't think it is an integral part of IPFS, but more like an add-on.
It all sounds good until the blockchain part. Why do you need a blockchain? Why can't you just use FlieCoin for incentivizing storage?
@blurHY: But why do you need a new currency. Can't you just use an existing one if it is only about incentivizing something?

I don't know the exact difference between communism and socialism. But to me these words indicate the concentration of power in a small political caste. For the people the incentives are such, that productivity is not rewarded and it thus leads to indifference and laziness. The current crisis showed also that a big part of the system in the West is socialist. For example the money. With the unlimited money printing, companies that were close to fail before the crisis receive big amounts of money. This debases the money for everybody. The common people who lose part of their wealth this way have no say in this process.
@blurHY: Jobs that produce something that is not needed is not a good allocation of resources.
Reminds me of this: https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/248748.The_Politically_Incorrect_Guide_to_Capitalism

@blurHY: It's the best system that humanity came up so far that works on a large scale. And pure capitalism has not been tried so far. All the western systems have a good deal of socialism woven into. And this socialism part is actually what allows the plutocrats to become ever more powerful. As long as they can bribe politicians to bend the laws in their favor, it is not a free market. I am by no means an expert in economics, but the arguments from the Austrian school are very compelling.
